content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of a function written in Julia:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia(.+?)```", md, seed = "\n"))  # extract code fences and contents
    
    # remove the backticks and join the lines together with a newline
    joined_code = join([replace(block.captures[1], "`" => "") for block in blocks]; '\n')
    
    return joined_code
end
```
This function extracts all the code blocks from an input markdown document, removes the backticks (code fences) and joins them together with a newline. The resulting string will be Julia code. It uses regex to find and extract these blocks, as well as replace the backticks within them.
